snippet: Malala Yousafzai, 14, grievously wounded by Taliban gunmen, remained stable but unconscious on Sunday as her Pakistani doctors debated whether to send her abroad for treatment. Before the attack, as she boldly advocated for girls' education in...
abstract: Malala Yousafzai, 14, grievously wounded by Taliban gunmen, remained stable but unconscious on Sunday as her Pakistani doctors debated whether to send her abroad for treatment. Before the attack, as she boldly advocated for girls' education in Pakistan, she seemed to be living up to her namesake, a 19th-century Afghan heroine.

headline.main: Pakistani Girl Shot by Taliban Was Named for a Battlefield Heroine
